De Niro pulls anti-vaccine docu

A controversial film about the discredited link between autism and vaccinations has been pulled from Robert De Niro’s Tribeca Film Festival, after the actor consulted “the scientific community” and found “concerns with certain things in this film.”

De Niro, 72, who is a father of an autistic child and co-founder of the festival, at first defended the decision to premiere Vaxxed: from Cover-Up to Catastrophe , despite outcry from doctors and researchers.

Repeated studies involving more than a million children have found there is no evidence to link childhood vaccines to autism. — PTI
title: ENT-DENIRO
